file_content.text: They're equipping the bombers to spray the hives with serum. Deadly to Killik young, entirely non-toxic to humans.
I've tested the formula on the Killik eggs. Here are your results.
Oh! Wonderful. A few adjustments, and we'll have the serum ready to go.
Six million larvae, dead in their eggs. It may sound unpleasant, but they'd do much worse to us.
We need to test that serum on the Killik eggs in time for the hatching cycle.
"Three Killiks crawling into the nursery... creeping past the royal guard; whatever do they see?"
I'm Doctor Ganalya, my lord. You must be interested in the Mother's Milk project.
I'm Doctor Ganalya, Science Bureau. You must be my latest muscle for the Mother's Milk project.
I'm Doctor Ganalya, Science Bureau. You must be here about the Mother's Milk project.
"Mother's Milk"?
"Mother's Milk"?
Was that a song about Killiks?
Were you just singing?
It's a local nursery rhyme about the kidnapping of a prince. Gruesome, but in the right spirit.
That depends on you.
Believe me, the results of the project will speak for themselves.
I'm developing a serum that neutralizes Killik larvae--toxic membrosia nectar, technically. Pump it into an egg, the babies feed; no more nest.
Moff Sarek wants enough serum to spray down the hives before the next hatching cycle. I'd gladly oblige, only my field testers keep disappearing.
What happened to them?
What happened to them?
Spray the hives with poison... that sounds like genocide.
You're wiping out the Killiks.
Oh, it's barely population control. Besides, better their children than mine.
This isn't my concern.
If we're going to stop six million larvae from swarming, we need to field test the formula.
I sent an armed squad to try the serum on Killik eggs. The boys took my equipment and never reported back.
I'm not deserving of Sith assistance, but the project is. Would you be willing, my lord?
We're running a small budget surplus. I can hire you to find their remains and finish the job.
Some angry Killik mother probably ate them, but your team is clearly more competent than mine was.
I'll finish the job.
I suppose it has to be done.
Excellent. Salvage the equipment from the last team and pick up where they left off.
These are their last known coordinates. I'll be here, writing the boys' next of kin.
Despicable. [Refuse quest]
Well, we'll just have to keep throwing warm bodies at the Killiks until the tests are done. Or until the hatching cycle is over.
One Killik egg can hold three hundred larvae. Did you know that?
